episodes.title: Democratic lawmakers accuse US attorney general of Epstein file 'cover-up' • FRANCE 24 English
episodes.description:
US Attorney General Pam Bondi on Wednesday was accused of engaging in a "cover-up" of the Jeffrey Epstein files and turning the Department of Justice into an "instrument of revenge" for Donald Trump. Bondi, testifying before the House Judiciary Committee, defended the DOJ's handling of the records about the convicted sex offender at a fiery hearing attended by several Epstein victims. FRANCE 24's International Affairs Editor Kethevane Gorjestani explains.
#Bondi #USCongress #Epstein

episodes.title: France seeks probe after diplomat cited in Epstein files • FRANCE 24 English
episodes.description:
France's foreign minister has requested a probe after the name of a French diplomat on leave appeared in numerous emails to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. "I was appalled," Foreign Minister Jean-Noel Barrot said on Wednesday. In an X post late on Tuesday, he said he was referring allegations against Fabrice Aidan to the public prosecutor, and launching an internal inquiry.
#France #Aidan #Epstein

episodes.title: Epstein fallout confined to Europe, prominent figures in US largely immune • FRANCE 24 English
episodes.description:
Angela Diffley is pleased to welcome former New York State Assistant Attorney General Reed Brody. As someone who has spent decades holding the powerful to account, from brutal dictators to state officials, he recognises patterns of impunity cloaked in the legal process. In the case of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein’s network, we’re witnessing a carefully protected ecosystem of elite immunity and impunity: the redacted names shielding the rich and powerful, and the stark contrast in accountability between the US and Europe. 
#Epstein #SexTrafficking #Maxwell

episodes.title: Starmer 'clinging on by his teeth' as fallout from Epstein files spreads • FRANCE 24 English
episodes.description:
UK premier Keir Starmer insisted he would not "walk away" on Monday after a prominent ally demanded the prime minister quit for embroiling the British government in the Jeffrey Epstein scandal. Scottish Labour leader Anas Sarwar called on Starmer to resign for appointing Peter Mandelson as US ambassador despite knowing he had maintained links to Epstein. But even as senior ministers rally around the beleaguered PM, it was clear Starmer is “clinging on by his teeth”, says France 24’s Philip Turle.
#Epstein #Starmer #Mandelson

episodes.title: Epstein files: Suspense focused on exposing elite and powerful over seeking justice for victims
episodes.description:
Angela Diffley is pleased to welcome Dr. Sam Martin, Political Communication Scholar at Boise University. As a scholar of conservative movements, she is deeply concerned with how power obscures harm.  In the Epstein case, what unsettles her most, in addition to the horrific abuse itself, is the way media and political systems pivot our attention away from the victims and toward the elites, namely powerful men, who may be embarrassed, implicated or exposed. The scandal becomes not about what happened to these girls, but about which elite might get named.
#Epstein

episodes.title: Ghislaine Maxwell: From socialite to Epstein accomplice • FRANCE 24 English
episodes.description:
Ghislaine Maxwell, the longtime associate of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, is set to be questioned behind closed doors by the US congress. Born into a life of privilege, Maxwell was the youngest daughter of British media tycoon Robert Maxwell. She went on to work for her father and became a well-known socialite, but her relationship with Jeffrey Epstein would eventually lead to her arrest in 2020. A year later she was found guilty of conspiring with Epstein to sexually abuse minors and sentenced to 20-years behind bars.

episodes.title: Ghislaine Maxwell to face US Congress as fallout from Epstein files continues • FRANCE 24 English
episodes.description:
Jeffrey Epstein's accomplice Ghislaine Maxwell, currently serving 20 years in prison for trafficking girls to the disgraced financier, will be questioned behind closed doors by the US Congress on Monday, though she's expected to invoke her right to not answer questions. It comes as the fallout from the publication of the latest release of the Epstein files continues, with veteran French politician Jack Lang, a former minister, the latest high-profile figure to fall under the spotlight.
#Epstein #Maxwell #Lang

episodes.title: Starmer faces pressure as McSweeny resigns: Police throw curveball on files • FRANCE 24 English
episodes.description:
Pressure is mounting on British Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer to step down, with criticism coming from both the opposition and within his own party. The crisis follows the release of the Epstein Files. While Starmer is not implicated, controversy surrounds his choice of US ambassador, Peter Mandelson, who resigned last September over leaked emails linking him to Jeffrey Epstein, a convicted sex offender, and now faces a criminal investigation, which he denies. Questions over Starmer’s judgement have intensified, with his chief of staff, Morgan McSweeney, resigning and taking responsibility for the appointment. France 24’s Gavin Lee is joined by James Lyons, former Director of Downing Street Communications under Keir Starmer (2024–2025).
#UK #MorganMcSweeny #Starmer

episodes.title: Links between Epstein and the Israeli government: What the files show • FRANCE 24 English
episodes.description:
The huge trove of Epstein documents released by the US Department of Justice has sent shock waves through Europe’s political, economic and social elites — dominating headlines, ending careers and spurring political and criminal investigations. This includes government intelligence agencies. Murtaza Hussein is a national security and Foreign Affairs Reporter for Drop Site News. He has been reporting on the links between the Epstein scandal and the Israeli government.
#JeffreyEpstein #Israel #scandal

episodes.title: Epstein Files: Veteran French politician loses post over tax fraud probe • FRANCE 24 English
episodes.description:
Veteran French politician Jack Lang, a former Culture Minister, was forced out of a the post of president of the Arab World Institute Saturday as pressure grew on him over revelations in the latest release of the Epstein files. He is accused of 'aggravated tax fraud laundering' linked to Jeffrey Epstein, but Lang continues to insist he is innocent of any wrongdoing. Details by FRANCE 24 international affairs editor, Shirli Sitbon.

episodes.title: Entitled: UK Monarchy, national security at risk amid Andrew’s ties to sex trafficking & shady deals
episodes.description:
Gavin Lee is pleased to welcome Dr. Andrew Lownie, Historian and Author of "Entitled: The Rise and Fall of the House of York". He spent four years investigating Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor and Sarah Ferguson, peeling back layers of royal secrecy and entitlement. What he found was a disturbing pattern of personal misconduct that might even implicate Princesses Beatrice & Eugenie. There are explosive revelations of systemic protection by the monarchy and the government that hid sex trafficking claims tied to Epstein and questionable business dealings that compromised national security.
#Monarchy #UK #Epstein

episodes.title: Epstein emails claim Bill Gates contracted STD, had sex with Russian girls • FRANCE 24 English
episodes.description:
The latest Jeffrey Epstein file dump by the US Department of Justice saw a number of high-profile individuals named, one of them being Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates. The documents allege new details of his ties to the late sex offender, including claims Gates hid a sexually transmitted disease from his wife after contact with "Russian girls". Gates has denounced the emails as false and says he "regrets" knowing Epstein. Vedika Bahl goes through what we know in Truth or Fake.
#jeffreyepstein #billgates #epsteinfiles

episodes.title: Epstein files: At least 16 documents have disappeared • FRANCE 24 English
episodes.description:
At least 16 files disappeared from the US Department of Justice’s public webpage containing documents related to Jeffrey Epstein less than a day after they were posted, including a file featuring a photograph connected to former President Donald Trump. The removals occurred without any explanation from the government or notice to the public. Trump has consistently denied any knowledge of Epstein’s crimes and has said he distanced himself from his former friend years ago. Being named or included in the files does not imply wrongdoing. The unexplained removals have sparked anger among politicians, as well as victims of the late sex offender and their families. Morgan Ayre has the details.
#Epsteinfiles #documents #DonaldTrump

episodes.title: Andrew's banishment from the royal family is largely welcomed by the UK • FRANCE 24 English
episodes.description:
King Charles stripped his disgraced brother Andrew of the title "Prince" on October 30, 2025, and evicted him from his royal residence. It comes after weeks of pressure to act over Andrew's relationship with sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. He will be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor and is expected to move to a property on the king's Sandringham estate and receive private financial support from his brother. But what do people in the UK make of the move?

episodes.title: Cults, mass graves, 'encounters with Jesus': In Kenya, freedom of worship comes under scrutiny
episodes.description:
In April 2023, Kenyan human rights defenders discovered a deadly cult in the Shakahola forest. They exhumed more than 400 bodies from mass graves. The pastor of the Good News International Ministries, Paul Mackenzie, had convinced his followers that by starving themselves to death, they would meet Jesus before the apocalypse struck the Earth. In Kenya, there is complete freedom of religion – anyone can preach as they wish. But in this case, the consequences were disastrous. A trial is currently taking place. FRANCE 24's Bastien Renouil reports.
#Kenya #starvationcult #freedomofworship

episodes.title: Kenya starvation cult leader goes on trial on terrorism charges • FRANCE 24 English
episodes.description:
In tonight's edition, the man accused of orchestrating the deaths in the notorious Shakahola forest massacres appears in court on terror charges. The bodies of hundreds of followers of self appointed religious leader Paul Mackenzie have been dug up from  the wilderness.  

Also, US troops pull out from their base in Niger's capital, completing a key phase in their total withdrawal from the country that was ordered by the military junta.

And hundreds of thousands of families in Mozambique's Cabo Delgado region continue to struggle daily with the aftermath of an underreported conflict. I hear from one of the UN chiefs trying to improve the conditions of the millions of displaced.

Read more about this story in our article: https://f24.my/ASdE.y

episodes.title: 'Spotlight' journalist Michael Rezendes gives us his take on bombshell French church sex abuse case
episodes.description:
Pulitzer-Prize winning journalist Michael #Rezendes shares his thoughts on a new report on sex #abuse in the French #CatholicChurch. Over 216,000 thousand children are thought to have been abused by priests and other church workers in #France over the past seventy years.
